post: The judging rounds for our MyImpact Challenge Contest are almost complete! We will announce the Grand Prize Winner, first through third place, and runners-up on Monday, July 7th, on our website and YouTube channel. Find out more about the contest and stay tuned for the announcement!  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3

Our veteran-owned affiliate partner Star Spangled Tea has over a dozen tea blends that have nods to historical figures and local flavors. Whether you're a history buff or a tea lover, use code 'BRI1791' to get a discount and support the Bill of Rights Institute with every purchase. A portion of your purchase helps us bring free civic education to classrooms nationwide. Visit  https://bit.ly/46ald2T to shop now.

#OTD in 2003 and 2015, respectively, the Supreme Court ruled on the cases of Lawrence v. Texas and Obergefell v. Hodges. Find resources that discuss the Constitutional arguments and outcomes of these decisions with students on our Pride Month playlist.  https://bit.ly/43f8W9f

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Mansi Bajaj! She is a high school junior from Aurora, Illinois. She is the vice president of her school's NEHS chapter and is the copy editor of her school's newspaper. Mansi has argued cases in the Illinois Supreme Court and has been awarded for her speaking and writing abilities. She is a dedicated student who excels in rigorous AP and honors classes. With her efforts, Mansi hopes to create meaningful change. BRIs Student Fellowship is a six-month educational program that helps high school students develop as leaders and develop skills in building civil society. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Join BRI's Tony Williams & political scientist and author Michael Nelson as they discuss FDR's court-packing plan and its significance in the history of American constitutional government. This episode of Scholar Talks focuses on FDRs leadership style, the reactions from Congress and the public, and the long-term impact of the plan on presidential power, party dynamics, and the balance among the three branches of government. Watch today!  https://bit.ly/3TtJjOR

We are grateful to the South Carolina Bar Foundation its support of the Bill of Rights Institute. This support will enable BRI to continue engaging teachers and students with high-quality resources and programming in the coming school year.

Teachers! We want you to participate in the Civic Star Challenge as you celebrate 250 years of American independence this upcoming school year! This nationwide opportunity will help you bring the ideals of the Declaration of Independence to life in your classroom. Open to K–12 educators who desire to spark creativity, discovery, and civic engagement. Don't miss this chance to win exciting prizes throughout the school year! Sign up now and be the first to hear when the Civic Star Challenge launches in August 2025:  https://lnkd.in/eQsPQWCj 🤝 @icivics  #CivicLearning  #CivicEducation  #Civics  #iCivics

Uncover the powerful message behind Frederick Douglass 1852 What to the Slave Is the Fourth of July? speech. Hear how he challenged the nations celebration of freedom while millions remained enslaved, and how he called Americans to live up to their founding ideals of liberty and justice.  https://lnkd.in/ew3WaRRW  #frederickdouglass  #juneteenth  #history  #americanhistory  #civilrights  #apushistory  #primarysources

Our affiliate partner, History By Mail is offering 5% off your order  and History by Mail will donate another 5% of your purchase to support BRI teachers. Use code BRI Shop today!  https://bit.ly/4n9iHQC

Today, we recognize the Attainment Company, Inc. as a proud supporter of our Civics for Everyone initiative. They have dedicated four decades to empowering individuals with disabilities by providing resources that promote independence and self-determination. Find out more about our Civics for Everyone initiative.  https://bit.ly/4jBYuQp
